Here are some R resources to check out:


1. Helpful website for asking questions: [Stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com)
2. [Learning Statistics with R](https://learningstatisticswithr.com/) (free access!)
3. [Data wrangling in R: load, explore, transform, and visualize data for modeling tidyverse libraries](https://learning.oreilly.com/library/view/data-wrangling-with/9781803235400/) (UNH students/faculty can access via the UNH Library)
4. [Guide on R Markdown](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/) (free access!)
